sentences: Osta punase mehega kogu oma elu.
Punase tüdruk on heas mõttes hull.
context: Punase is the genitive singular form of the Estonian adjective 'punane', which means 'red'. In genitive case, it indicates possession or association with something red. It can be translated as 'of the red' or simply 'red' depending on context. This form is used when modifying a noun that is in the genitive case.
